name: The Westin Grande Sukhumvit, Bangkok

reviews.text: Overall, I was disappointed by the hotel, which does not deserve the high ratings it has received on Tripadvisor. I have stayed at five other first class/luxury hotels in Bangkok, and this was my least favourite.
reviews.title: Indeed - you can do better than the Westin

likes.liked: — The large and well equipped room
likes.disliked: — Everything else was average or disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not impressive, but rather ugly from the outside, and it doesn't get better inside. The lobby is small, soulless and lacking the elegance of a Bangkok 5 star hotel. It was cheapened further by a rather downmarket clothing sale that was held in the lobby area during our stay.
reviews.title: You can do much better in Bangkok

likes.disliked: — A sequence of just getting things wrong

reviews.text: The lobby bar and restaurant are very modern, but unappealing. We had afternoon tea - the quality of the sandwiches and pastries was very poor and we sat in an unpleasant aircon draft. We also had dinner at the Med restaurant - the food was average measured against the high Bangkok standards.
reviews.title: Doesn't meet the expectations set out in review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool is not bad, but not impressive either. The gym is cramped and full of people who are not hotel guests.
reviews.title: Safe Choice

likes.disliked: — Difficult to say, public areas maybe.....

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel was the room, which was quite large and pleasant, with a really comfy bed and good bedlinen.
reviews.title: Feel Good Experience

reviews.text: Made two stays during one week at the Bangkok Westin. The stays were divided by a 4 day trip to the beach.
reviews.title: Good hotel but let down by some silly points...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was fine, in line with other Westin hotels in Asia and worldwide.
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes

reviews.text: Our rate included breakfast, which was pretty decent. Also we recieved voucers for a free dinner in "The Med" and two free drinks at the bar. On the first of the visits the buffet at "The Med" was not really very good, but on the second stay it was astounding. We have no idea why the selection and quality changed so much between a Friday night and the following Sunday.
reviews.title: Best place I have ever stayed - like ever!

likes.liked: — The service, the food, the location, the quality, the room the everything!!!

reviews.text: Some minus points from the stay:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and excellent beds

reviews.text: 1- the hotel seemed far less flexible than I would normally see at a Westin. One example was around check-out. Our rate included 4pm late check-out and I'm also SPG gold. They would not extend this at all without paying either 50% of the room rate, 50USD or 3750 points. This was even after saying that the hotel was not close to full for the followign evening.
reviews.title: Disappointed

aka: The Westin Grande Sukhumvit, Bangkok Hotel Bangkok
description: Experience the Westin difference at The Westin Grande Sukhumvit, Bangkok, a contemporary retreat in the heart of the city’s thriving business and entertainment district. The hotel is steps from the BTS Asok skytrain and MRT Sukhumvit subway stations ensuring guests are moments away from the city’s best shopping, vibrant nightlife, and unique cultural attractions.
